diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,248 @@
+# -*- Python -*-
+
+load(
+    "@bazel_tools//tools/cpp:configure_util.bzl",
+    "find_cc",
+    "get_cxx_inc_directories",
+)
+
+
+_DEFAULT_CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH = "/usr/local/cuda"
+_DEFAULT_CUDNN_INSTALL_PATH = "/usr/local/cuda"
+
+
+def _cuda_toolkit_path(repository_ctx):
+  """Finds the cuda toolkit directory."""
+  cuda_toolkit_path = _DEFAULT_CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH
+  if "CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH" in repository_ctx.os.environ:
body:
According to the [User Manual](http://www.bazel.io/docs/bazel-user-manual.html#the-clean-command):

> It is safe to invoke a Bazel command in the same client while the asynchronous expunge continues to run. Note, however, that this may introduce IO contention.

Might be a better to not use `--expunge_async` in this case then.
body_html:
According to the User Manual:

It is safe to invoke a Bazel command in the same client while the asynchronous expunge continues to run. Note, however, that this may introduce IO contention.

Might be a better to not use --expunge_async in this case then.
body_text:
According to the User Manual:

It is safe to invoke a Bazel command in the same client while the asynchronous expunge continues to run. Note, however, that this may introduce IO contention.

Might be a better to not use --expunge_async in this case then.
